0.title: Features
0.content: . | DVD Authoring | DVD Menus | Output | Video Input | Audio Input | Subtitles | Supported Platforms . | Windows | . | .

1.title: DVD Authoring
1.content: . | Define DVD structure with XML | Assign first play command | Multiple titles (up to 99) | Multiple video objects (VOB) per title (up to 10) | Multiple chapters per title | End play commands (jump to title, jump to menu) | DVD Virtual Machine Commands | .

2.title: DVD Menus
2.content: . | Create disc menu (VMGM) | Create video titleset root menus (VTS) | Create title menus | Use MPEG still picture or movie for menu background | Define up to 36 buttons per menu | Define buttons mask, transparency and highlight color | Navigate between titles from different title sets | .

3.title: Output
3.content: . | NTSC and PAL TV formats supported | 4:3 and 16:9 aspect ratio supported | Built-in MPEG-2 multiplexer | Built-in subtitle encoder | Outputs a finished VIDEO_TS directory with VOB, IFO and BUP files | Use PrimoBurner™ for DVD burning (requires a separate PrimoBurner license) | .

4.title: Video Input
4.content: . | MPEG-2 program stream | MPEG-2 elementary video stream | DVD Video OBject file (VOB) import | Read from a callback interface or directly from a file | Includes AVBlocks™ - a production quality MPEG-2 encoder | .

5.title: Audio Input
5.content: . | MPEG-2 elementary audio | AC3 (Dolby Digital) elementary audio | DTS elementary audio | Detect multiple audio streams and assign them to specific language | Read from a callback interface or directly from a file | .

6.title: Subtitles
6.content: . | Subpicture stream (encoded as MPEG-2 PS) | Subtitles in Spruce Technologies STL format | Detect multiple subtitle streams and assign them to specific language | Read from a callback interface or directly from a file | .

7.title: Supported Platforms
7.content: Windows . | Windows 11 · 10 · Windows 8.1 · Windows 8 · Windows 7 SP1 | Windows Server 2022 · 2019 · 2016 · 2012 R2 | 64Bit · Dynamic Libraries · Unicode | C++ · .NET CLR 4 (4.0 to 4.8) | Visual Studio 2022 · 2019 · 2017 | .

11.title: Commercial / Full License
11.content: $3000 / year . This license is for established businesses and organizations: . | Fixed annual fee per product, per platform | No additional royalties | No hidden fees | . Please contact DVDBuilder Sales.

12.title: Discounts
12.content: Competitive product . $2250 / year (20% OFF) . Users of commercial products competitive to DVDBuilder qualify for a 20% OFF towards standard commercial license for DVDBuilder. Please contact DVDBuilder Sales. Startup . $1500 / year (50% OFF) . This discount is available to any company that meets all the following requirements: . | Is privately held, and | Has been in business for no more than 3 years, and | Is engaged in development of a software-based product or service, and | Is an established business with a website and/or existing public references on the Internet. | . License issued for 1 year. Must apply again to renew. Please contact DVDBuilder Sales. Educational institution . FREE . Classroom licenses allow for use of the fully-functional version of DVDBuilder for educational and teaching purposes in classrooms by professors, trainers, and students. | May be provided for students and teachers to be used for classroom assistance. | Allows the software to be installed and used in on-site classrooms and labs. | Allows students and teachers to use the software on their personal PCs for educational tasks, such as preparing training materials or doing homework. | . Please contact DVDBuilder Sales. Open source project . FREE . Non-commercial Open Source projects can qualify for free license to DVDBuilder provided that they meet a set of simple criteria: . | You have to be a project lead or a regular committer. | Your OS project meets the Open Source definition. | You do not perform any paid support, consulting or training services for your OS project, and you do not distribute paid versions of your OS software. | Your OS project is in active development for a minimum of 3 months. | Your OS project’s community is active. This means that you have recent activity in your newsgroups or forums. | Your OS project has a website including either a regularly updated News section or links to social network account(s) where project updates are posted. | You release updated builds on a regular basis. | Your project license is a commercial use friendly license (i.e. not GPL, AGPL, LGPL, MPL or any other copyleft license). | . License issued for 1 year. Must apply again to renew. Please contact DVDBuilder Sales.

16.title: C++ API
16.content: DVDBuilder Core (C++ / C) . NOTE: Both the C++ and the .NET API documentation is generated using Doxygen.

17.title: Wiki
17.content: On the DVDBuilder Wiki you will find how-to articles and code snippets about the C# and C++ SDKs.

18.title: Samples
18.content: DVDBuilder Samples is a repository of code samples on GitHub. The same code samples (pre-built) are included with the DVDBuilder packages which can be downloaded from the Download page.

19.title: Support
19.content: Technical support for DVDBuilder is provided via GitHub.

20.title: Feature requests
20.content: Please create an issue on GitHub.

21.title: Report a bug
21.content: Please create an issue on GitHub.

22.title: Contact us
22.content: You can always send an email to DVDBuilder Support.

23.title: Introduction
23.content: DVDBuilder SDK is a DVD authoring software development kit that uses XML for describing various DVD features like video titles, chapters, menus, subtitles and languages.

24.title: Features
24.content: . | Use XML to specify DVD features | Menus and languages | Subpicture and subtitles | Standard VIDEO_TS output that can be burned to DVD | Best DVD playback compatibility in the industry | Includes AVBlocks (Video SDK) | Integrates with PrimoBurner (Burning SDK) | .

25.title: Solutions
25.content: . | Create DVD from MPEG-2 video files | Create DVD with menus using still images and moving backgrounds | Create DVD with multiple titles and chapters | Record live MPEG-2 stream to DVD in real time | .
